title.rendered: The Volvo 850 Can Survive Anything

content.rendered: Many people love to talk trash when it comes to Volvos, but throughout the years, the Swedish automaker has prided itself on producing some of the safest vehicles the world has ever known. Their point is proven when you watch this video. This is a Volvo 850 in a one car demolition derby! After countless crash tests, the car not only demolishes everything it hits but it keeps on driving!

title.rendered: 50 Million Dollar Disappearing Garage

content.rendered:
You might think you’ve got the ultimate garage, but do you have one with a subterranean storage lair?

Check out this Lake Tahoe estate with a massive 30 car underground garage that’s accessed by way of a massive hydraulic lift! Well it only costs $50 million!

title.rendered: Reckless Biker Splitting Lanes Eats It Hard

content.rendered:
Lane splitting on a bike is one of the big advantages of a motorcycle in heavy traffic. However, you not only have to be sure you can legally do it (only legal in California), but you have to be EXTREMELY careful.

These two bikers were screaming down a highway in Georgia while illegally lane splitting. Sure enough, disaster strikes. They are moving entirely too fast when a car in front of them changes lanes. The first biker can’t correct in time and completely eats bumper and flies over his handle bars!

title.rendered: Russian Train Surfing is a Way of Life

content.rendered:
People in Russia like to do some pretty crazy things. From holding day long Vodka parties, to feeding bears, to train surfing. That’s right…Train Surfing.

This guy has taken some high quality GoPro footage of himself running past and hiding from rail way security as he makes his was on to the roof of a moving train then jumps between cars as it speeds along!

title.rendered: Man Forgets Car Has Brakes

content.rendered: This poor guy left his car in gear (and dashcam running, thanks for that). He’s walking in front of it when he sees it start to roll forward. Naturally, he panics and decides…to stop it with his body! He obviously fails and the car slowly rolls into several motorcycles and causes a good bit of damage. That’s one hell of an oops!

title.rendered: Police Chase Ends with Car Crashing Into House

content.rendered:
This police chase was tearing through a residential area when it ended abruptly. Police were after this perpetrator who was on the run because he had narcotics and marijuana on him. As this deputy closed in, the man crashed his truck into the side of someone’s home. He climbed out of the car for a brief foot chase before being run down by the deputy.

That’s not all! The woman you see run from behind the car lived in that house. She was actually in the driveway getting her purse out of a car when the suspect’s crash almost crushed her!

title.rendered: Amazing Propeller-based Hoverboard

content.rendered: A company named Omni has put together this incredible hoverboard which is as terrifying as it is amazing. It’s powered by two propellers located directly underneath the user’s feet. There’s almost no housing for the blades, and the thought of standing on spinning propellers is just scary as all hell. If this is an early model or prototype, maybe they’ll find ways to make it a bit safer!

title.rendered: The Worst Cars of 2015

content.rendered: Consumer Reports has put out its 2015 list of best and worst cars. They don’t hold back. They claim the Chrysler 200 has a raspy engine alongside klutzy handling. They also rip the Land Rover Discovery Sport for having a flat-footed engine and a lacking entertainment system. Check out what else they reviewed in the highlights presented in this video!

title.rendered: Lamborghini Veneo Roadster Seen in the Wild!

content.rendered:
Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills sees plenty of exotic and super cars, but few are unique as this. Feast your eyes on the Lamborghini Veneno Roadster. When it comes to rare Lamborghinis, this sits pretty high on the list. There were only 9 Veneno Roadster models ever produced alongside 3 hard tops. It’s got a 740 HP, 6.5 liter V-12 and a gorgeous matte black exterior.

SouthBayExotics was lucky enough to capture footage of one roaming Beverly Hills and posted it for all to enjoy!

title.rendered: You’ve Never Seen a Burnout THIS Intense!

content.rendered:
Justen Brown was set on performing a massive burnout in his Holden Ute when he let his excitement get the best of him! He’s performing nicely with his 337 cubic inch supercharged Chev engine when everything goes up in flames (but in a really bad ass way!).

You’d think he’d stop the moment he notices the fire but instead he keeps on going! He winds up absolutely melting his rear tires and grilling his Ute’s rear, but if you ask us, it was worth it!

title.rendered: Angry Ram Stops a Dirt Biker

content.rendered: This is pretty damn funny! This dirt biker is traveling along some trails, minding his own business, when he runs across a very territorial ram. They have a brief standoff before the ram takes action and rams the bike. The biker hops off and tries to figure out a way past the animal without incurring more of its wrath. The ram starts starts charging him! He tries to grab the ram by the horns but fails and finally gives up.

title.rendered: Don’t Do This if You Get Arrested

content.rendered:
We aren’t sure why the guy was arrested. We also aren’t sure why he felt that screaming in the cop’s ear would help the situation. What he did next was even worse…

He spits on the cop. The cop immediately pulls over and hauls him out of the seat. You’d think he was pulled out to receive a hell of a beating but all the cop does is wrap the guys shirt around his head! That must be standard operating procedure for cops that get spit on a lot!

title.rendered: Idiot Pulls Out in Front of Fire Truck

content.rendered:
The point of view we’re getting is from a fire truck that’s responding to a call. The truck has their lights and sirens going. They are chugging along to save lives and a women pulls out in front of them causing a massive accident. How’d this happen?

First of all, realize that everyone came out of this accident relatively unharmed. That’s pretty incredible when you consider how big that firetruck is and how hard they T-Boned the car. The woman claims that when she pulled up to the stop she heard the siren but couldn’t locate the truck (sun was blinding her). She pulled out and realized all too late that the truck was barreling towards her!

title.rendered: Koenigsegg Crash is as Expensive as it is Cringe Worthy

content.rendered: During the 2013 Gran Turismo Polonia, a driver was taking out this Koenigsegg for a few trips around the track. From the beginning, it’s easy to see that this driver is out of his league. He’s having a hard time controlling the power but he keeps pushing it. He winds up crashing into several spectators!

title.rendered: Can This Boat Engined Roadster Take on a Bugatti Chiron?

content.rendered:
Feast your eyes on the incredible Packard Royal Streamliner. This is one of the most unique custom roadsters ever built. Why you ask? Well, it’s powered by a V-12 Packard Royal Streamliner engine that came right out of a WWII era Patrol Torpedo Boat. It’s running off of a 1940’s boat engine technology that can produce a whopping 1,600 HP along with 3,000 feet-pounds of torque! Another way of looking at that is realizing that the Bugatti Chiron is sitting on nearly equivalent numbers!

The Packard Royal is also similar to the new Bugatti when it comes to price. The custom roadster costs a breezy $1,750,000. However, any potential owner to this amazing vehicle gets what they pay for. The roadster comes with two transmissions and two drive-lines. The car is also massive. It measures in at a whopping 32 feet long, much like a boat, and weighs an incredible 13,200 pounds! While the weight and size alone might not let it come close to the speed of a Bugatti, it’d definitely be a car worth owning in a world where money was no object.

category.name: Luxury
category.description: The finer things in life sometimes come to us on four wheels. If you like your cars to have a silver spoon in their grills, these are the stories for you.

title.rendered: The First Snowmobile Backflip on Water!

content.rendered:
You wouldn’t think there’s much reason to hit the water in a snow mobile, but if you’re able to get them moving at a decent clip, they’ll sit above the water with the right handling. David Burman took his Ski-doo 600 RS snowmobile out on the water for a day of record shattering.

The jump is about 22 meters long and it’s incredible to watch him actually stick the landing!

category.name: Insane Stunts
category.description: YEEHAW! If it gives you a rush, gets your blood pumping, makes your jaw drop, whatever, we feature all of it here. Strap in, bros!

title.rendered: Epic Road Rage Ending!

content.rendered:
This dashcam captured footage of a brief confrontation between two drivers in China. It’s a simple case of one driver trying to merge blindly and another driver not letting them in. It ends with some instant karma!

They play cat and mouse for a few seconds. Finally, the Honda cuts the car off, slows to a complete stop on the highway, and gets out of the car to throw down. However, he forgets to leave his car in park so it starts rolling…karma!
